Judul: ANTHIHEPATO TOXIC ACTIVITY OF MALPHIGHIA COCCOGERA L. EXTRACT
Abstrak: The antihepatotoxic action of Malpighia COCCIGERA Linn. (Bunga Mutiara) leaves has been studied on carbon tetrachloride induced liver injury in three months old albino male Wistar rat weighing about 205 Â± 35g. has been studied. The results showed that the ageous extract at a dose of 0.625 g/kg of body weight did not influence the rat's sleeping time neither the onset of sleeping time significantly whereas in doses of 1,25 and 2.5g/kg of body weight the effects were significant (P 0.05). Oral administration of carbon tetrachloride in doses of 1,2 and 3 ml/kg of body weight increased the serum transminase activities up to 1236.5 Â± 675.5 % and the liver weight up to 25 Â± 9 g. After 72 hours of carbon tetrachloride administration, the doses of 1,25 and 2.5g/kg of body weight decreased significantly (P 0.05) the strum level of transminase, alkaline phosphatase and total bilirubin respectively.
Kata Kunci: Anthihepato toxic; Malphighia COCCOGERA L.; Aqeous extract
